meanings.definition: To inhale or draw in through the mouth
meanings.sent1: I suk in the fresh air deeply.
meanings.sent2: She likes to suk on a lollipop.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner decided to suk up all the dust bunnies.
meanings.sent4: The black hole seemed to suk in everything around it.
meanings.sent5: As the wind blew, I could suk the scent of flowers.

meanings.definition: A slang term for something that is bad or unpleasant
meanings.sent1: That movie was a real suk.
meanings.sent2: He always brings bad luck, what a suk.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled milk turned into a suk surprise.
meanings.sent4: The rainy day was a real suk on our plans.
meanings.sent5: The broken toy was a suk to the child's happiness.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Thailand
meanings.sent1: I need to exchange some dollars for suk.
meanings.sent2: The souvenir cost a few siks.
meanings.sent3: He found a lost wallet full of suk.
meanings.sent4: The street vendor only accepted suk for the fruit.
meanings.sent5: She saved up enough suk for a nice vacation.
